subject: Re: [junit] Running tests in a logical flow..
msgSnippet: ... Hash: SHA1 [quote Arun J::on 3/30/2005 7:42 AM] ... Even if this dependent-independent may give birth to long discussions, I encourage you to give TestNG a
messageBody:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

[quote Arun J::on 3/30/2005 7:42 AM]
>
> Folks,
>
> I am trying to do the following two things..
>
> #1. I have multiple related tests and I am trying to execute them in a
> logical flow. say
> Test1.run();
> if(Test1_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test2.run();
> if(Test2_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test3.run();
> Test4.run();
> if(Test4_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test5.run();
> }
> }
> }
>
> #2. I wanted to call these test programmatically as mentioned above.
> So I would like to give my own test name that are not starting with
> test. Since jUnit tester will pick up testXXX irrespective.
>
> How to go about doing this? Have anyone encountered problem of this kind.
>
> ~JAK
> PS: I can't use TestSuite becoz I wanted a logical flow in executing
> my tests and not executing them in a specific order.
>
> On 29 Mar 2005 16:49:46 -0000, junit Moderator
> <junit-owner@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>>
>>

>>

>
Even if this dependent-independent may give birth to long discussions, I encourage you to give
TestNG a try (and surely I am subjective about this). As far as i can say it will provide you
exactly what you are looking for.
